title: 25+ Best Fonts for Engraving (Wood, Metal and Leather)
description: If you’re on the lookout for the best fonts for engraving, we’ve got you covered! Here are our top 12 picks in the category! For more options, keep scrolling. Engraving ... Read more
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Discover the best fonts for engraving, perfect for wood, metal, leather and even laser cutting. Check out the best engraving fonts right here.
text: If you’re on the lookout for the best fonts for engraving, we’ve got you covered! Here are our top 12 picks in the category! For more options, keep scrolling. Engraving is a timeless art form used for centuries to create beautiful and intricate designs on various surfaces. Whether you’re engraving a special piece of jewelry or creating a personalized gift, choosing the right font is crucial to achieving the desired effect. In this article, we will explore some of the best fonts for engraving and provide tips on choosing the perfect font for your project. Below is an overview of all the best engraving fonts, and further below we categorize them by wood, metal, leather, and laser engraving. UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Fonts for Engraving. image credit: Envato Elements Download all the fonts for engraving you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! Wood engraving is a printmaking method, wherein a craftsman works a design into a block of wood. It uses relief printing, which involves the artist applying ink to the face of the block and printing with relatively low pressure, making it a functional variation of another etching practice called woodcut. Wood engraving typically involves key chains, tables, and picture frames! Let’s check out our list of the best wood engraving fonts. 1. Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script. image credit: Envato Elements Let’s start with one of our absolute favorites in this category! One font that has consistently stood out for us is the Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script font. This font’s ability to seamlessly adapt is something we truly admire. It comes with normal spacing and can easily be optimized to fit a wide range of sizes. From our own encounters, we’ve noticed that this font truly comes to life on various surfaces like wooden picture frames, plaques, and glass coasters. It’s not hard for us to envision how well it complements these materials. The font’s subtly crafted shapes lend it a universal appeal, making it a great choice for all sorts of projects. Its extensive features, including both uppercase and lowercase characters, numerals, punctuation, alternates, ligatures, and multilingual support, further contribute to its flexibility. When faced with the decision of selecting the perfect font for a wooden engraving project, we wholeheartedly recommend considering the Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script font. From our point of view, it has the potential to enhance the aesthetics of your project significantly. However, if you are delving into another project, considering the use of brush script fonts might be an intriguing option. 2. Pinto – A Hand-Drawn Font Family Pinto – A Hand Drawn Font Family. image credit: Design Cuts At first glance, you can almost immediately tell that the Pinto family font is a staple in wooden crafts. In our experience, when searching for the best fonts for engraving, we’ve personally found that the irregular, hand-lettered aesthetic of this font brings a genuine human touch to various items, accompanied by an array of meticulous details. Additionally, within this font family, there are 14 diverse styles encompassing sans-serif, serif, and slab-serif designs, including variations such as narrow, shadow, outline, engraved, and engraved display. From our encounters, we’ve observed that this engraving-inspired font seamlessly enhances everything from picture frames to wooden plates, demonstrating its versatility. There’s virtually no surface where this font wouldn’t shine, making it undoubtedly one of the top choices for engraving wood. 3. AZ Chuga Engrave AZ Chuga Engrave. image credit: Envato Elements Say hello to an engraving font aesthetic that’s perfect for wooden clocks, wall decoration woodcrafts, and wooden lampshades! Do you see it? Because we definitely do! When it comes to seeking out the best fonts for engraving, we’ve come across one aspect that truly stood out to us. We discovered that AZ Chuga Engrave has remarkable uppercase and lowercase characters, numerals, symbols, punctuation, and multilingual support. Furthermore, we were impressed by the font’s standard spacing and its effortless adaptability to different sizes. 4. Furius Furius. image credit: Envato Elements When it comes to sourcing the best fonts for engraving, we’ve come across a font pack that truly caught our attention. Here’s a font pack that brings a little more complexity to any wooden trinket. One thing we can attest to is that the Furius introduces an added layer of complexity that beautifully complements wooden trinkets. If you aim to find a font pack that encompasses a wealth of nuance, we wholeheartedly recommend this choice! The Furious font boasts an array of OpenType features and equally incorporates an extended character set encompassing both Latin and Cyrillic characters. This, in turn, provides a versatile and all-encompassing design solution. For those seeking to craft photoengraved woodwork or tailor-made wooden furniture, this contender emerges as an exceptional selection! Its recurring lines introduce a serene pattern to every wooden piece, and its tastefully crafted curves and edges contribute to a sophisticated aesthetic. 5. Lexlox Font Fonts for Engraving. image credit: Envato Elements Based on our own encounters in the world of the best fonts for engraving, we can confidently affirm that Lexlox stands out as a fresh and distinctive option, ideally suited for engraving wooden clocks and watches. This font displays a formal yet modern essence, boasting exceptional readability. If your perspective aligns with ours, you likely appreciate how textual aesthetics like Lexlox seamlessly blend formal and futuristic elements. Consequently, we highly suggest utilizing this font for a wide array of wooden crafts that you might envision! 6. Joane Typeface Joane Typeface. image credit: Design Cuts Make your wooden design projects stunning with this beautiful font that mixes the elegance of French didones, calligraphic endings, and glyphic serifs. The curves of this font have been beautifully designed, and its features convey a warm, unique style. To add more versatility to your designs, Joane font comes in both engraved and deco versions. Moreover, the Joane Typeface font features 18 weights, from thin to black. With so many features, this font is perfect for personalized coasters, mugs, and even wooden trophies! Best Fonts for Leather Engraving Leather products can be personalized or given an appealing look through the process of leather engraving. The cycle includes designs permanently etched into the surface of any leather-involving item. Leather engraving is performed by stamping or cutting the design onto the surface of the leather with specialized tools. Pieces that require leather engraving are usually wallets, belts, and bags! Let’s check out our list of the best leather engraving fonts. 7. Barracuda Display – Logo Font Barracuda Display – Logo Font. image credit: Creative Market Here’s an all-caps version of classic copperplate Gothic families we know you’re going to like for engraving projects. This font has elegant and distinctive letterforms with several characters, making it suitable for personalized leather tote bags. The Barracuda Display font comes in two styles, too — regular and bold. It features standard characters, numerals, punctuation, and more. If you’re feeling creative and generous, we suggest that you give this font a try on other leather items too, like leather key fobs and leather notebooks!! 8. Eyelash – Decorative Script Font Eyelash – Decorative Script Font. image credit: Design Cuts Presenting Eyelash, a beautiful and elegant classic calligraphy script that’s great for leather projects like stationery kits, belts, and wallets.  To add, we like how this font features distinctive curves at the start and end of the design with upper and lower-case engravings, giving it an even more intimate feel to whatever leather item you’re designing. 9. Linocut Handmade Script Font Kid Linocut Handmade Script Font Kid. image credit: Creative Market Linocut is a hand-cut font featuring uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and more. This linocut-inspired typeface comes in two file formats — OTF and TTF. As a result, we think it’d make a perfect option for personalized leather giveaways at weddings, corporate events, and birthday parties! Its rugged look gives it a personal touch and its uneven lines make it instantly appealing! 10. Hustle Faster Typeface Hustle Faster Typeface. image credit: Creative Market Discover a very stylish font that is very suitable for type and logotype called Hustle Faster Typeface. This font comes in two different styles — smooth and round, making it perfect for getting variations and flavors for leather picks. You can use these styles individually or combine them to make your designs more versatile. Considering how charming it looks, we definitely see this design in bag packs, belts, and leather watches. 11. Vonder – Vintage Sans Serif Font Vonder – Vintage Sans Serif Font. image credit: Creative Market Elevate any wooden creation with this cool, rough-textured, and bold display font that is suitable for a wide range of design needs. No matter the wooden giveaway, the Vonder font will be an incredible asset to your font library. It comes with uppercase characters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, stylistic alternates, and multilingual support. Use it for belts, bags, and all sorts of leather straps! 12. Barn Acre Sketch Font Barn Acre Sketch Font. image credit: Creative Market Meet Barn Acre Sketch Font, another one of our personal favorites. It’s a unique font that is perfect for your sketching and engraving projects. This font includes uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual characters. Are you on the lookout for leather print fonts? We think this would make such a strong statement on nearly any wearable leather you can think of! 13. CPC Team Armada CPC. image credit: Envato Elements Inspired by seafaring ships fit for battle, CPC Team is an extended-width typeface perfect for engravings wallets, notebooks, and laptop bags. This font comes in four weights — light, regular, medium, and bold. The font has a low contrast in light and regular weights and a high contrast in medium and bold weights. Everything considered, we like how formal, legible, and well-spaced out each characters here are. 14. Canberra Script Canberra Script. image credit: Design Cuts Canberra Script is a classy handwritten font with distinctive curves and some eye-catching features that are perfect for stereotypically feminine-style leather projects like bags, coin purses, and even shoes! It features both start and end engraved in uppercase & lowercase, numerals, symbols, punctuations, and beautiful ligatures. This font includes alternative glyphs and multilingual support. Outside of leather designs, you can use this font for wedding design projects, fashion, greetings, invitations, social media, and more, too. Text, logos, pictures, numbers, and 2D codes can all be engraved on metal. Various strategies work best on various metals, and every metal has its assets, shortcomings, and optimal applications, contingent upon its components. Examples here are aluminum, metal, and gold to give some examples. Generally, you see metal engraving on jewelry like rings and necklaces! Let’s check out our list of the best metal engraving fonts, which are also double as the best laser engraving fonts. 15. 1522 Vicentino 1522 Vicentino. Image credit: Design Cuts Did someone ask for jewelry engraving fonts? Inspired by the engraved characters of the small book known as “Operina,” 1522 Vicentino is a versatile font suitable for a wide range of design needs. This font also gets its inspiration from the method and rules for writing cursive letters or chancery scripts from the famous calligrapher Ludovico Vicentino Arrighi, published in Roma in 1522 and signed with simplicity “Ludovico Vicentino.” It features a set of standard characters, alternative characters: twice lower cases, four sets of standard capitals, variants, titling, and so much more, clearly making it one of the best fonts for engraving metal! 16. Marcelo – Engraved Font Marcelo – Engraved Font. image credit: Design Cuts Bring your projects to the highest level with this engraved serif font, perfect for any metal project! If you’re feeling generous and creative, dare we say its look even makes it the best font for engraving glass! Furthermore, this bundle is equipped with standard characters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, and multilingual support. The unique design of this font will make your projects more beautiful and inspiring. To access the stylistic alternates in this font, you will require professional design software such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, or Inkscape. 17. Kingfisher Layered Font Kingfisher Layered Font. image credit: Design Cuts Here’s a layered font that comes with two styles of engraved layers. This font family comes in 4 styles — regular, full engraved, half engraved and extruded. You can use these styles individually or mix and match them to make your designs stand out. As a result, we like how the Kingfisher Layered font would make a spectacular pick for metal necklaces, cups, and utensils! 18. Ignorance Ignorance. image credit: Envato Elements Get a script typeface that mimics traditional handwriting found in America in the 19th century. This font is full of vitality and personality, making it suitable for a wide range of design needs. Ignorance features standard letters, numerals, ligatures, punctuations, swashes, alternates, and more. As a result, we think this one’s the best font for engraving initials! If you’re looking to customize a ring for a loved one with their name on it, we can’t recommend this font contender enough! 19. Roijer Roijer. Image credit: Design Cuts Born from a branding exercise done with “high care,” Röijer is a special font that combines elegance and audacity in a very magistral way. Each letterform and every type of design process in this font is worked as a typographic jewel, as a strong bond between classical and fresh concepts (with a Lombardic and Art Nouveau touch). Röijer includes normal fonts, engraved fonts, dingbats, and ornaments. This font puts a dual capital model in your hands, making it an ideal choice for specific moments. All that said, we’re sure this would make a statement for personalized metal pens! 20. Balian Typeface Balian Typeface. image credit: Envato Elements This font is inspired by Balinese style carvings because it is made in Bali, and the Balinese also make it. The unique and beautiful engraving forms create a display font with character. That said, the Balian font is perfect for metal trophies, medals, and plaques! Its floral patterned design can give any metal item a distinct strikingness to it, making this font all the more perfect for whatever kinds of metal needs to be engraved. 21. Emanule Display Casual Emanule Display Casual. image credit: Envato Elements Belonging to the sans-serif family of typefaces, Emanule is a display casual typeface with fun but bold looks that give you an urban vibe. This font is equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, glyphs, ligatures, alternates, and multilingual support. As a result, we think this pick would make a good option for metal rings, necklaces, and even cups! 22. Forester Business Font Handbrush Forester Handbrush Business Font. image credit: Envato Elements Here’s a hand-brushed typeface specially made for producing amazing-looking fonts. With distinctive strokes, the Forester Handbrush font looks natural, making it suitable for all your metal masterpieces. It features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, glyphs, ligatures, alternates, and multilingual support. Are you customizing spoons, forks, knives, and metal business cards? Perhaps this font pack should help you add a statement to whatever metal item you’re personalizing next. 23. The Brown Fox Elegant Marker The Brown Fox Stylish Marker. image credit: Envato Elements Here’s a stylish marker font with a brush style perfect for all of your metal designs! Known as “The Brown Fox Elegant Market,” this font includes uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, ligatures, and multilingual support, which is also exactly why we know this is a versatile contender! All things considered, we see this font utilized in necklaces, plaques, and even kitchenware! 24. Kattalyna Brush Signature Kattalyna Brush Signature. image credit: Envato Elements Bloom your designs with this bold handwritten font with a very detailed brush texture with Kattalyna Brush Signature font. This font looks natural, elegant, and modern and is equipped with standard characters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, alternates, and more. That said, we know it’ll look great on metal giveaways for corporate settings, parties, and a whole lot more! 25. Craved Story – Engraved & Solid Serif Craved Story – Engraved & Solid Serif. image credit: Design Cuts Craved Story is an engraved and solid serif font that’s perfect for use in vintage-themed rings. This font is specially created to add a stylish and elegant impression to all sorts of metal jewelry. But don’t take our word for it only! Feel free to use it however you need to! And the best part? You can use the engraved and solid versions of this font individually or mix and match them to make your metal designs unique. 3 Primary Types of Engraving Hand Engraving  The most established and most relentless strategy, this method is performed by a gifted craftsman and a little etching instrument. Since the work is finished by a human, the etching may not be essentially as precise the way it would be with computer-controlled etching, however many individuals pick hand-etching as a result of its old-world appeal and craftsmanship esteem. It is also the most costly choice out of the three etching techniques considering how tedious it very well may be. Rotary Machine Engraving  This method of engraving creates the engraving by employing a machine-controlled tool. The plan is pre-modified into a PC that controls the machine, making the etching as immensely precise as possible. Turning to machine etching is more efficient than hand-etching since it requires nearly less manual investment, yet it can’t be utilized on materials that are heat-sensitive. The process’s friction has the potential to heat up and cause damage to jewelry made of glass, plastic, or delicate gemstones, so be wary of which kind of materials you’re using with this method. Laser Engraving  The most recent and adaptable method of engraving is laser engraving. As the name of the strategy reveals, the engraving is done with a laser beam that is very concentrated. The beam’s thickness can be changed to make the engraving wider or narrower. Additionally, the laser can be strengthened to carve more deeply into the base material, enhancing the engraving’s texture. All things considered, discover our list of the 25 best fonts for engraving, including wood engraving, leather and metal. Tips for Choosing the Right Engraving Font Choosing the right font for your engraving project can be challenging, but there are some tips that can help. Here are some things to consider when choosing a font: Purpose: What is the purpose of the engraving? Is it a formal occasion like a wedding or graduation, or is it a more casual gift? Readability: Make sure the font is easy to read, especially if the engraving is small. Contrast: Choose a font that contrasts well with the surface you are engraving on. For example, a light-colored font may not show up well on a silver or gold surface. Personalization: If you are engraving a personalized gift, consider using a script font or a font that has special meaning to the recipient. Cool Fonts Best Fonts for Signages Best Modern Fonts Frequently Asked Questions Can the same font be used for wood and leather engraving? Yes, fonts like Barracuda Display and Eyelash Script work well for both wood and leather due to their versatility and readability on textured surfaces. What fonts are best for metal engraving, especially jewelry? 1522 Vicentino, Marcelo Engraved, and Kingfisher Layered are ideal for metal engraving, offering detailed designs that look elegant on jewelry. What should I consider for laser engraving fonts? Choose fonts with clear lines and good contrast like Roijer and Furius. They engrave well on various materials, ensuring clean, precise designs. Can script fonts be used for engraving? Yes, script fonts like Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script and Canberra Script add a personal touch to leather, wood, and metal projects, perfect for gifts and custom items. Are all fonts suitable for small engravings like rings? No. Fonts like Ignorance and Craved Story are best for small items like rings due to their clear, simple designs that stay readable when scaled down. Best Engraving Fonts Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script Furius Linocut Handmade Script Font Kid Barracuda Display - Logo Font Roijer Hustle Faster Typeface Vonder - Vintage Sans Serif Font Lexlox Font Barn Acre Sketch Font Kingfisher Layered Font 1522 Vicentino The Brown Fox Stylish Marker Engraving is a beautiful and timeless art form that can add a personal touch to any gift or occasion. Choosing the right font for your engraving project is crucial to achieving the desired effect. Whether you choose a classic serif font, a modern serif font, or an elegant script font, make sure to consider the purpose, readability, contrast, and personalization of your engraving. While these aren’t exactly free fonts for laser engraving, these are premium font choices we’re sure will be able to help you choose the perfect font for your project and create a truly unique and special gift. That’s it! We hope you enjoyed our selection of the 20+ best fonts for engraving that will surely help you create stunning designs. Whichever font style for engraving you select, you’re assured of adding a more natural and authentic engraved look to your projects!

If you’re on the lookout for the best fonts for engraving, we’ve got you covered! Here are our top 12 picks in the category! For more options, keep scrolling.

Engraving is a timeless art form used for centuries to create beautiful and intricate designs on various surfaces.

Whether you’re engraving a special piece of jewelry or creating a personalized gift, choosing the right font is crucial to achieving the desired effect.

In this article, we will explore some of the best fonts for engraving and provide tips on choosing the perfect font for your project.

Below is an overview of all the best engraving fonts, and further below we categorize them by wood, metal, leather, and laser engraving.

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the fonts for engraving you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

Wood engraving is a printmaking method, wherein a craftsman works a design into a block of wood. It uses relief printing, which involves the artist applying ink to the face of the block and printing with relatively low pressure, making it a functional variation of another etching practice called woodcut. Wood engraving typically involves key chains, tables, and picture frames!

Let’s check out our list of the best wood engraving fonts.

1. Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script

Let’s start with one of our absolute favorites in this category! One font that has consistently stood out for us is the Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script font. This font’s ability to seamlessly adapt is something we truly admire.

It comes with normal spacing and can easily be optimized to fit a wide range of sizes.

From our own encounters, we’ve noticed that this font truly comes to life on various surfaces like wooden picture frames, plaques, and glass coasters. It’s not hard for us to envision how well it complements these materials.

The font’s subtly crafted shapes lend it a universal appeal, making it a great choice for all sorts of projects.

Its extensive features, including both uppercase and lowercase characters, numerals, punctuation, alternates, ligatures, and multilingual support, further contribute to its flexibility.

When faced with the decision of selecting the perfect font for a wooden engraving project, we wholeheartedly recommend considering the Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script font.

From our point of view, it has the potential to enhance the aesthetics of your project significantly.

However, if you are delving into another project, considering the use of brush script fonts might be an intriguing option.

2. Pinto – A Hand-Drawn Font Family

At first glance, you can almost immediately tell that the Pinto family font is a staple in wooden crafts.

In our experience, when searching for the best fonts for engraving, we’ve personally found that the irregular, hand-lettered aesthetic of this font brings a genuine human touch to various items, accompanied by an array of meticulous details.

Additionally, within this font family, there are 14 diverse styles encompassing sans-serif, serif, and slab-serif designs, including variations such as narrow, shadow, outline, engraved, and engraved display.

From our encounters, we’ve observed that this engraving-inspired font seamlessly enhances everything from picture frames to wooden plates, demonstrating its versatility.

There’s virtually no surface where this font wouldn’t shine, making it undoubtedly one of the top choices for engraving wood.

3. AZ Chuga Engrave

Say hello to an engraving font aesthetic that’s perfect for wooden clocks, wall decoration woodcrafts, and wooden lampshades! Do you see it? Because we definitely do!

When it comes to seeking out the best fonts for engraving, we’ve come across one aspect that truly stood out to us. We discovered that AZ Chuga Engrave has remarkable uppercase and lowercase characters, numerals, symbols, punctuation, and multilingual support.

Furthermore, we were impressed by the font’s standard spacing and its effortless adaptability to different sizes.

4. Furius

When it comes to sourcing the best fonts for engraving, we’ve come across a font pack that truly caught our attention. Here’s a font pack that brings a little more complexity to any wooden trinket.

One thing we can attest to is that the Furius introduces an added layer of complexity that beautifully complements wooden trinkets. If you aim to find a font pack that encompasses a wealth of nuance, we wholeheartedly recommend this choice!

The Furious font boasts an array of OpenType features and equally incorporates an extended character set encompassing both Latin and Cyrillic characters.

This, in turn, provides a versatile and all-encompassing design solution. For those seeking to craft photoengraved woodwork or tailor-made wooden furniture, this contender emerges as an exceptional selection!

Its recurring lines introduce a serene pattern to every wooden piece, and its tastefully crafted curves and edges contribute to a sophisticated aesthetic.

5. Lexlox Font

Based on our own encounters in the world of the best fonts for engraving, we can confidently affirm that Lexlox stands out as a fresh and distinctive option, ideally suited for engraving wooden clocks and watches.

This font displays a formal yet modern essence, boasting exceptional readability.

If your perspective aligns with ours, you likely appreciate how textual aesthetics like Lexlox seamlessly blend formal and futuristic elements.

Consequently, we highly suggest utilizing this font for a wide array of wooden crafts that you might envision!

6. Joane Typeface

Make your wooden design projects stunning with this beautiful font that mixes the elegance of French didones, calligraphic endings, and glyphic serifs. The curves of this font have been beautifully designed, and its features convey a warm, unique style.

To add more versatility to your designs, Joane font comes in both engraved and deco versions. Moreover, the Joane Typeface font features 18 weights, from thin to black. With so many features, this font is perfect for personalized coasters, mugs, and even wooden trophies!

Best Fonts for Leather Engraving

Leather products can be personalized or given an appealing look through the process of leather engraving. The cycle includes designs permanently etched into the surface of any leather-involving item. Leather engraving is performed by stamping or cutting the design onto the surface of the leather with specialized tools. Pieces that require leather engraving are usually wallets, belts, and bags!

Let’s check out our list of the best leather engraving fonts.

7. Barracuda Display – Logo Font

Here’s an all-caps version of classic copperplate Gothic families we know you’re going to like for engraving projects. This font has elegant and distinctive letterforms with several characters, making it suitable for personalized leather tote bags. The Barracuda Display font comes in two styles, too — regular and bold.

It features standard characters, numerals, punctuation, and more. If you’re feeling creative and generous, we suggest that you give this font a try on other leather items too, like leather key fobs and leather notebooks!!

8. Eyelash – Decorative Script Font

Presenting Eyelash, a beautiful and elegant classic calligraphy script that’s great for leather projects like stationery kits, belts, and wallets.  To add, we like how this font features distinctive curves at the start and end of the design with upper and lower-case engravings, giving it an even more intimate feel to whatever leather item you’re designing.

9. Linocut Handmade Script Font Kid

Linocut is a hand-cut font featuring uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and more. This linocut-inspired typeface comes in two file formats — OTF and TTF. As a result, we think it’d make a perfect option for personalized leather giveaways at weddings, corporate events, and birthday parties!

Its rugged look gives it a personal touch and its uneven lines make it instantly appealing!

10. Hustle Faster Typeface

Discover a very stylish font that is very suitable for type and logotype called Hustle Faster Typeface. This font comes in two different styles — smooth and round, making it perfect for getting variations and flavors for leather picks. You can use these styles individually or combine them to make your designs more versatile.

Considering how charming it looks, we definitely see this design in bag packs, belts, and leather watches.

11. Vonder – Vintage Sans Serif Font

Elevate any wooden creation with this cool, rough-textured, and bold display font that is suitable for a wide range of design needs.

No matter the wooden giveaway, the Vonder font will be an incredible asset to your font library. It comes with uppercase characters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, stylistic alternates, and multilingual support. Use it for belts, bags, and all sorts of leather straps!

12. Barn Acre Sketch Font

Meet Barn Acre Sketch Font, another one of our personal favorites. It’s a unique font that is perfect for your sketching and engraving projects. This font includes uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual characters.

Are you on the lookout for leather print fonts? We think this would make such a strong statement on nearly any wearable leather you can think of!

13. CPC Team

Inspired by seafaring ships fit for battle, CPC Team is an extended-width typeface perfect for engravings wallets, notebooks, and laptop bags.

This font comes in four weights — light, regular, medium, and bold. The font has a low contrast in light and regular weights and a high contrast in medium and bold weights. Everything considered, we like how formal, legible, and well-spaced out each characters here are.

14. Canberra Script

Canberra Script is a classy handwritten font with distinctive curves and some eye-catching features that are perfect for stereotypically feminine-style leather projects like bags, coin purses, and even shoes! It features both start and end engraved in uppercase & lowercase, numerals, symbols, punctuations, and beautiful ligatures.

This font includes alternative glyphs and multilingual support. Outside of leather designs, you can use this font for wedding design projects, fashion, greetings, invitations, social media, and more, too.

Text, logos, pictures, numbers, and 2D codes can all be engraved on metal. Various strategies work best on various metals, and every metal has its assets, shortcomings, and optimal applications, contingent upon its components. Examples here are aluminum, metal, and gold to give some examples. Generally, you see metal engraving on jewelry like rings and necklaces!

Let’s check out our list of the best metal engraving fonts, which are also double as the best laser engraving fonts.

15. 1522 Vicentino

Did someone ask for jewelry engraving fonts? Inspired by the engraved characters of the small book known as “Operina,” 1522 Vicentino is a versatile font suitable for a wide range of design needs.

This font also gets its inspiration from the method and rules for writing cursive letters or chancery scripts from the famous calligrapher Ludovico Vicentino Arrighi, published in Roma in 1522 and signed with simplicity “Ludovico Vicentino.”

It features a set of standard characters, alternative characters: twice lower cases, four sets of standard capitals, variants, titling, and so much more, clearly making it one of the best fonts for engraving metal!

16. Marcelo – Engraved Font

Bring your projects to the highest level with this engraved serif font, perfect for any metal project! If you’re feeling generous and creative, dare we say its look even makes it the best font for engraving glass! 3 Primary Types of Engraving

  • Hand Engraving 

The most established and most relentless strategy, this method is performed by a gifted craftsman and a little etching instrument. Since the work is finished by a human, the etching may not be essentially as precise the way it would be with computer-controlled etching, however many individuals pick hand-etching as a result of its old-world appeal and craftsmanship esteem.

It is also the most costly choice out of the three etching techniques considering how tedious it very well may be.

  • Rotary Machine Engraving 

This method of engraving creates the engraving by employing a machine-controlled tool. The plan is pre-modified into a PC that controls the machine, making the etching as immensely precise as possible. Turning to machine etching is more efficient than hand-etching since it requires nearly less manual investment, yet it can’t be utilized on materials that are heat-sensitive.

The process’s friction has the potential to heat up and cause damage to jewelry made of glass, plastic, or delicate gemstones, so be wary of which kind of materials you’re using with this method.

  • Laser Engraving 

The most recent and adaptable method of engraving is laser engraving. As the name of the strategy reveals, the engraving is done with a laser beam that is very concentrated. The beam’s thickness can be changed to make the engraving wider or narrower.

Additionally, the laser can be strengthened to carve more deeply into the base material, enhancing the engraving’s texture.

All things considered, discover our list of the 25 best fonts for engraving, including wood engraving, leather and metal.

Tips for Choosing the Right Engraving Font

Choosing the right font for your engraving project can be challenging, but there are some tips that can help. Here are some things to consider when choosing a font:

  • Purpose: What is the purpose of the engraving? Is it a formal occasion like a wedding or graduation, or is it a more casual gift?
  • Readability: Make sure the font is easy to read, especially if the engraving is small.
  • Contrast: Choose a font that contrasts well with the surface you are engraving on. For example, a light-colored font may not show up well on a silver or gold surface.
  • Personalization: If you are engraving a personalized gift, consider using a script font or a font that has special meaning to the recipient.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can the same font be used for wood and leather engraving?

Yes, fonts like Barracuda Display and Eyelash Script work well for both wood and leather due to their versatility and readability on textured surfaces.

What fonts are best for metal engraving, especially jewelry?

1522 Vicentino, Marcelo Engraved, and Kingfisher Layered are ideal for metal engraving, offering detailed designs that look elegant on jewelry.

What should I consider for laser engraving fonts?

Choose fonts with clear lines and good contrast like Roijer and Furius. They engrave well on various materials, ensuring clean, precise designs.

Can script fonts be used for engraving?

Yes, script fonts like Helloo Gladiattor Brush Script and Canberra Script add a personal touch to leather, wood, and metal projects, perfect for gifts and custom items.

Are all fonts suitable for small engravings like rings?

No. Fonts like Ignorance and Craved Story are best for small items like rings due to their clear, simple designs that stay readable when scaled down.

Best Engraving Fonts

Engraving is a beautiful and timeless art form that can add a personal touch to any gift or occasion.

Choosing the right font for your engraving project is crucial to achieving the desired effect.

Whether you choose a classic serif font, a modern serif font, or an elegant script font, make sure to consider the purpose, readability, contrast, and personalization of your engraving.

While these aren’t exactly free fonts for laser engraving, these are premium font choices we’re sure will be able to help you choose the perfect font for your project and create a truly unique and special gift.
